intro: Benthamia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar benthamia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
